trans-unit.source: The CURRENT SCHEMA function returns the schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references.

seg-source.mrk: The CURRENT SCHEMA function returns the schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references.

target.mrk: The CURRENT SCHEMA function returns the schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references.

trans-unit.source: CURRENT SCHEMA and CURRENT SQLID are synonyms.

seg-source.mrk: CURRENT SCHEMA and CURRENT SQLID are synonyms.

target.mrk: CURRENT SCHEMA and CURRENT SQLID are synonyms.

trans-unit.source: These functions return a string of up to 128 characters.

seg-source.mrk: These functions return a string of up to 128 characters.

target.mrk: These functions return a string of up to 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: -- Set the name column default to the current schema: CREATE TABLE mytable (id int, name VARCHAR(128) DEFAULT CURRENT SQLID) -- Inserts default value of current schema value into the table: INSERT INTO mytable(id) VALUES (1) -- Returns the rows with the same name as the current schema: SELECT name FROM mytable WHERE name = CURRENT SCHEMA

seg-source.mrk: -- Set the name column default to the current schema: CREATE TABLE mytable (id int, name VARCHAR(128) DEFAULT CURRENT SQLID) -- Inserts default value of current schema value into the table: INSERT INTO mytable(id) VALUES (1) -- Returns the rows with the same name as the current schema: SELECT name FROM mytable WHERE name = CURRENT SCHEMA

target.mrk: -- Set the name column default to the current schema: CREATE TABLE mytable (id int, name VARCHAR(128) DEFAULT CURRENT SQLID) -- Inserts default value of current schema value into the table: INSERT INTO mytable(id) VALUES (1) -- Returns the rows with the same name as the current schema: SELECT name FROM mytable WHERE name = CURRENT SCHEMA
